definitions.plainLanguage: A stable identifier used to uniquely refer to an entity across systems and time.
definitions.notes: Changing this meaning would invalidate joins, references, and external integrations.

definitions.plainLanguage: The given name by which a person is primarily identified, typically assigned at birth.
definitions.notes: May change through legal name change; not reliable as identifier.

definitions.plainLanguage: The family name or surname by which a person is identified.
definitions.notes: May change through marriage or legal process.

definitions.plainLanguage: The complete name by which a person or organization is commonly identified.
definitions.notes: Not reliable as an identifier; formatting and ordering may vary.

definitions.plainLanguage: An additional given name positioned between the first and last names.
definitions.notes: Optional in many cultures; may be absent or multiple.

definitions.plainLanguage: An honorific or title appearing before a person's name.
definitions.notes: Common values: Mr., Ms., Mrs., Dr., Prof.

definitions.plainLanguage: A designation appearing after a person's name indicating generation, credentials, or honors.
definitions.notes: Common values: Jr., Sr., III, Esq., PhD, MD.

definitions.plainLanguage: The calendar date on which a person was born.
definitions.notes: Used for age verification and identity confirmation.

definitions.plainLanguage: The number of years a person has lived since birth.
definitions.notes: Should be calculated from dateOfBirth rather than stored independently.

definitions.plainLanguage: The gender identity by which a person identifies themselves.
definitions.notes: Distinct from biological sex; may change through self-identification.

definitions.plainLanguage: The racial or ethnic group with which a person identifies.
definitions.notes: Categories vary by jurisdiction and reporting requirements.

definitions.plainLanguage: A government-issued numeric identifier assigned to individuals for tax and benefit purposes.
definitions.notes: US-specific; requires encryption at rest and in transit.

definitions.plainLanguage: A government-issued identifier authorizing an individual to operate motor vehicles.
definitions.notes: Format varies by issuing jurisdiction; may be reissued.

definitions.plainLanguage: A government-issued identifier appearing on a travel document authorizing international travel.
definitions.notes: Changes on renewal; format varies by country.

definitions.plainLanguage: An electronic mail address used to contact a person or organization.
definitions.notes: Should not be treated as a stable identifier.

definitions.plainLanguage: A telephone number used to reach a person or organization by voice or text.
definitions.notes: Store in E.164 format for international compatibility.

definitions.plainLanguage: A telephone number associated with a portable cellular device.
definitions.notes: Often used for two-factor authentication.

definitions.plainLanguage: A telephone number associated with a person's place of employment.
definitions.notes: Tied to employment; changes with job changes.

definitions.plainLanguage: A telephone number for receiving facsimile transmissions.
definitions.notes: Declining in usage; often organizational rather than personal.

definitions.plainLanguage: The street number and name portion of a physical mailing address.
definitions.notes: Part of postal address; combine with city, state, postal code.

definitions.plainLanguage: Secondary address information such as apartment, suite, or unit number.
definitions.notes: Optional; vCard extended-address is deprecated in favor of combined streetAddress.

definitions.plainLanguage: The name of the municipality or locality within an address.
definitions.notes: Municipal names rarely change but boundaries may shift.

definitions.plainLanguage: The administrative region or territory within a country.
definitions.notes: Use ISO 3166-2 codes for interoperability.

definitions.plainLanguage: A code used by postal services to identify a geographic delivery area.
definitions.notes: Format varies by country; US uses 5 or 9 digit ZIP codes.

definitions.plainLanguage: An administrative division between city and state, typically used for local governance.
definitions.notes: US-centric; other countries use different administrative divisions.

definitions.plainLanguage: The nation or sovereign state associated with an address or entity.
definitions.notes: Use ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes for interoperability.

definitions.plainLanguage: The angular distance north or south of the equator, expressed in degrees.

drivers: moderate sensitivity when combined with longitude

definitions.notes: Range: -90 to 90; use WGS84 datum.

definitions.plainLanguage: The angular distance east or west of the prime meridian, expressed in degrees.

drivers: moderate sensitivity when combined with latitude

definitions.notes: Range: -180 to 180; use WGS84 datum.

definitions.plainLanguage: A complete postal address including all components needed for mail delivery.
definitions.notes: Prefer structured address components over concatenated string.

definitions.plainLanguage: A numbered box at a post office where mail is held for collection.
definitions.notes: Alternative to street address; cannot receive packages from some carriers.

definitions.plainLanguage: The date and time when this record was originally created.
definitions.notes: Often used for auditing, sorting, and lifecycle calculations.

definitions.plainLanguage: The date and time when this record was last updated.
definitions.notes: Should be updated automatically by the system on any change.

definitions.plainLanguage: The date and time when this record was marked for deletion or removed.
definitions.notes: Used for soft deletes; null indicates active record.

definitions.plainLanguage: The date and time when an event, period, or validity begins.
definitions.notes: Defines the beginning of a time-bounded entity.

definitions.plainLanguage: The date and time when an event, period, or validity concludes.
definitions.notes: May be null for ongoing or indefinite periods.

definitions.plainLanguage: A precise moment in time, typically including both date and time components.
definitions.notes: Store in UTC; convert to local time for display.

definitions.plainLanguage: A four-digit representation of a calendar year.
definitions.notes: Use when only year precision is meaningful.

definitions.plainLanguage: A numeric representation of a month within a year.
definitions.notes: Values 1-12; often combined with year for period references.

definitions.plainLanguage: A numeric representation of a day within a month.
definitions.notes: Values 1-31; valid range depends on month.

definitions.plainLanguage: A representation of time of day without date information.
definitions.notes: 24-hour format; include timezone offset when relevant.

definitions.plainLanguage: The length of time between two points, expressed as a measurable interval.
definitions.notes: ISO 8601 format: P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S

definitions.plainLanguage: A twelve-month accounting period used for financial reporting, which may differ from the calendar year.
definitions.notes: Start date varies by organization; US federal is Oct 1.

definitions.plainLanguage: A three-month period representing one fourth of a fiscal or calendar year.
definitions.notes: Values Q1-Q4; must be paired with year for unambiguous reference.

definitions.plainLanguage: A calendar date without time information.
definitions.notes: Use when time precision is not required.

definitions.plainLanguage: A numeric monetary value expressed in a specified currency.
definitions.notes: Should be paired with a currency definition using ISO 4217 codes.

definitions.plainLanguage: The monetary value asked or offered in exchange for a product or service.
definitions.notes: Prices change over time; version or timestamp for historical accuracy.

definitions.plainLanguage: The monetary expenditure incurred to acquire or produce something.
definitions.notes: Distinct from price; represents buyer's perspective.

definitions.plainLanguage: The total income generated from business activities before expenses are deducted.
definitions.notes: Typically aggregated over a period; pair with fiscal period.

definitions.plainLanguage: The net amount remaining in an account after debits and credits.
definitions.notes: Point-in-time value; changes with each transaction.

definitions.plainLanguage: The monetary sum transferred to satisfy an obligation or purchase.
definitions.notes: Immutable once payment is recorded.

definitions.plainLanguage: The system of money in which a monetary value is denominated.
definitions.notes: Use ISO 4217 three-letter codes: USD, EUR, GBP, etc.

definitions.plainLanguage: A numeric or alphanumeric identifier assigned to a financial or customer account.
definitions.notes: Requires protection; often partially masked in display.

definitions.plainLanguage: A nine-digit code identifying a US financial institution for electronic transfers.
definitions.notes: US-specific ABA routing transit number; also called RTN.

definitions.plainLanguage: A numeric identifier embossed on a payment card used for transactions.
definitions.notes: Subject to PCI-DSS; never store full PAN unencrypted.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique code assigned to a specific financial or business transaction.
definitions.notes: Primary key for transaction records; must be globally unique.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique identifier assigned to a billing document requesting payment.
definitions.notes: Often sequential within an organization.

definitions.plainLanguage: The monetary value of taxes applied to a transaction.
definitions.notes: May require breakdown by tax jurisdiction.

definitions.plainLanguage: A reduction from the standard price of a product or service.
definitions.notes: May be absolute amount or percentage; clarify in context.

definitions.plainLanguage: A label indicating the current state of an entity within a defined process or lifecycle.
definitions.notes: Meaning depends entirely on the process that defines valid states.

definitions.plainLanguage: A classification that identifies the fundamental kind or category of an entity.
definitions.notes: Typically immutable after creation; changing type often requires new record.

definitions.plainLanguage: A grouping or classification used to organize entities by shared characteristics.
definitions.notes: Categories may be hierarchical; see subcategory.

definitions.plainLanguage: A more specific classification nested within a broader category.
definitions.notes: Must reference a valid parent category.

definitions.plainLanguage: A ranking that indicates the relative importance or urgency of handling an item.
definitions.notes: Common values: Low, Medium, High, Critical.

definitions.plainLanguage: A boolean indicator showing whether an entity is currently in use or operational.
definitions.notes: Often used as soft-delete indicator; false = inactive.

definitions.plainLanguage: A boolean indicator showing whether an entity has received formal approval.
definitions.notes: Often paired with approvedDate and approvedBy fields.

definitions.plainLanguage: A boolean indicator showing whether information has been confirmed as accurate.
definitions.notes: Should track verification method and timestamp separately.

definitions.plainLanguage: The origin from which data or information was obtained.
definitions.notes: Essential for data lineage and provenance tracking.

definitions.plainLanguage: The medium or pathway through which a transaction or communication occurred.
definitions.notes: Common values: Web, Mobile, Phone, In-Person, API.

definitions.plainLanguage: User-assigned labels used for organizing, searching, or filtering content.
definitions.notes: Freeform unless constrained by controlled vocabulary.

definitions.plainLanguage: A reference to the hierarchically superior entity that contains or owns this entity.
definitions.notes: Creates tree structures; null indicates root-level entity.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique reference to a person or organization that purchases goods or services.
definitions.notes: Primary key for customer records across systems.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique reference to a person who interacts with a system or application.
definitions.notes: Distinct from customerId; may overlap if customer has account.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique reference to a user account or business account within a system.
definitions.notes: May represent financial account, user account, or business account.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique reference to a company, institution, or other organized entity.
definitions.notes: May link to external identifiers like DUNS or LEI.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique reference to a support case, legal case, or incident record.
definitions.notes: Format varies by domain: legal, support, medical, etc.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique reference to a purchase order or sales order.
definitions.notes: Often displayed to customers; may follow sequential pattern.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique reference to a specific good or service offered for sale.
definitions.notes: May link to SKU, GTIN, or manufacturer part number.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique reference to a supplier or service provider.
definitions.notes: Used in procurement and accounts payable contexts.

definitions.plainLanguage: A unique reference to a person employed by an organization.
definitions.notes: Internal identifier; persists even if employee leaves and returns.

definitions.plainLanguage: The official name under which an organization conducts business.
definitions.notes: May differ from legal name; see legalName for registered name.

definitions.plainLanguage: A division or unit within an organization responsible for a specific function.
definitions.notes: Organizations frequently restructure departments.

definitions.plainLanguage: The official designation of a person's role within an organization.
definitions.notes: Changes with promotions; maintain history if needed.

definitions.plainLanguage: A function or position that defines a person's responsibilities and permissions.
definitions.notes: Often used for access control; distinct from job title.

definitions.plainLanguage: The person to whom an employee reports within an organizational hierarchy.
definitions.notes: Reference to employeeId; changes with reorganizations.

definitions.plainLanguage: A sequential or formatted number assigned to identify an employee.
definitions.notes: Often human-readable unlike UUID-based employeeId.

definitions.plainLanguage: The date on which a person began employment with an organization.
definitions.notes: Used for tenure calculations and benefit eligibility.

definitions.plainLanguage: The date on which a person's employment with an organization ended.
definitions.notes: Null for current employees; may trigger access revocation.

definitions.plainLanguage: The primary label or title by which an entity is identified.
definitions.notes: Generic name property; use specific variants when context is known.

definitions.plainLanguage: A textual explanation providing details about an entity.
definitions.notes: Free-form text; may contain markdown or HTML depending on context.

definitions.plainLanguage: Free-form text containing supplementary information or observations.
definitions.notes: Unstructured; review for PII before sharing.

definitions.plainLanguage: A web address pointing to a resource or page on the internet.
definitions.notes: Validate format; URLs may become stale over time.

definitions.plainLanguage: A web address pointing to an image file representing an entity.
definitions.notes: Should point to accessible image; consider caching.

definitions.plainLanguage: A location reference to a file within a storage system.
definitions.notes: Format varies by OS; prefer URLs or object storage keys.

definitions.plainLanguage: A short alphanumeric identifier used for quick reference.
definitions.notes: Human-readable shorthand; often used in dropdowns.

definitions.plainLanguage: A stock keeping unit code that uniquely identifies a product for inventory purposes.
definitions.notes: Internal to retailer; not universal like GTIN.

definitions.plainLanguage: A machine-readable code printed on products for scanning and identification.
definitions.notes: gtin12 for UPC, gtin13 for EAN, gtin14 for 14-digit.

definitions.plainLanguage: A universally unique identifier generated using standardized algorithms.
definitions.notes: RFC 4122 format: 8-4-4-4-12 hexadecimal characters.

definitions.plainLanguage: A fixed-length string computed from data to verify integrity or uniqueness.
definitions.notes: Specify algorithm used; SHA-256 recommended.

definitions.plainLanguage: A label indicating a specific iteration or release of an entity.
definitions.notes: Consider semantic versioning: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH.

definitions.plainLanguage: A numeric value indicating position or order within a series.
definitions.notes: May be auto-incremented; gaps possible if records deleted.

definitions.plainLanguage: A reference to a group of records or items processed together.
definitions.notes: Useful for tracing bulk operations and rollbacks.

definitions.plainLanguage: A secret token used to authenticate requests to an application programming interface.
definitions.notes: Never log or expose; rotate regularly; store hashed.

definitions.plainLanguage: A numeric label identifying a device on a computer network.
definitions.notes: May be PII in some jurisdictions; dynamic IPs change frequently.

definitions.plainLanguage: An identifier assigned by an external system to refer to the same entity.
definitions.notes: Changes may break synchronization with external systems.
